Description: Floor and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl; convex ring foot with central nipple (?) and scraped groove on resting surface; glazed black on interior, exterior (streaky on foot) and underside; reserved: junction of wall and foot, groove in resting surface with added red wash (?); resting surface worn or reserved; impressed decoration on interior, parts of four alternately linked palmettes surrounded by circle of blurred rouletting.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Rotroff, Agora XXIX no. 640 pl. 142 (P4420).
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 47 no. D 9 pl. 20.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1789)
